name: yarr
description: yarr (yet another RSS reader) is a self-hosted web-based feed reader. It fetches RSS/Atom feeds on a schedule, supports tags and search, and presents content in a clean, keyboard-friendly UI.
features: Feed aggregation: Subscribe to RSS and Atom feeds from blogs, news sites, and podcasts in one unified reader.
Automatic updates: Fetch new articles on a configurable schedule without manual refreshing or polling.
Keyboard navigation: Navigate articles, mark as read, and manage feeds using efficient keyboard shortcuts.
Tag organization: Group feeds with custom tags for better organization and filtered reading views.
Full-text search: Find articles across all subscribed feeds using keyword search with instant results.
Read/unread tracking: Automatically mark articles as read when viewed and maintain reading progress across sessions.
OPML import/export: Migrate feed subscriptions from other readers or backup your collection in standard format.
Minimal interface: Focus on content with a clean, distraction-free design that prioritizes readability.
Single binary deployment: Run the entire application from one executable file without complex dependencies.
Local storage: Store all articles and feed data in a local SQLite database for fast access and privacy.
Article filtering: Hide or highlight articles based on keywords, sources, or custom rules to reduce noise.
Mobile responsive: Read feeds comfortably on phones and tablets with a responsive web interface.
